guidanceItem.title: Strong account and password policies are enforced for the server.
guidanceItem.Priority: J.D. Meier, Alex Mackman, Michael Dunner, Srinath Vasireddy, Ray Escamilla and Anandha Murukan
guidanceItem.content:
Applies to

  • Web Application

What to Check For

Check to ensure that strong account and password policies are enforced for the server.

How to Fix

To counter password guessing and brute force dictionary attacks on your application, apply strong password policies. To enforce a strong password policy:

  • Set password length and complexity. Require strong passwords to reduce the threat of password guessing attacks or dictionary attacks. Strong passwords are eight or more characters and must include both alphabetical and numeric characters.
  • Set password expiration. Passwords that expire regularly reduce the likelihood that an old password can be used for unauthorized access. Frequency of expiration is usually guided by a company's security policy.

Table below shows the default and recommended password policy settings.

Password Policy Default and Recommended Settings

Enforce password history1 password remembered.24 passwords remembered.

In addition, record failed logon attempts so that you can detect and trace malicious behavior.
